name: Dickie Bush Listicle Formula
creator: Dickie Bush
description: High-engagement numbered list posts with strong hooks and skimmable insights

hook.format: Number + Bold claim (e.g., '7 lessons from $5M in revenue:')
examples: 5 mistakes I made building my first company:

guidelines: Each item should be skimmable in 3 seconds

cta.format: Question that invites sharing or personal experience
examples: What would you add to this list?

strategic_insights: Lists with 7-10 items perform 40% better than 3-5 items (more perceived value)
Hook must include NUMBER + OUTCOME to stop scroll
Each list item = one tweet's worth of content (can be repurposed)
Odd numbers (7, 9) feel more authentic than round numbers (5, 10)
Personal stakes in hook ("$5M", "10 years") increase credibility
when_to_use: Breaking down complex topic into digestible parts
Testing audience interest in a topic (outline as content)
Repurposing long-form content into social posts
common_mistakes: Making list items too long (should be 1-2 sentences max)
Not numbering items clearly (use 1., 2., 3. or emojis)
Weak hook that doesn't promise specific value
pro_tips: Front-load best insights (item #1 and #2 should be strongest)
Use white space aggressively (short paragraphs = more readable)
Include ONE contrarian take in the list
Add time context ('in 2024', 'last year') for relevance
